main event: Ground-radar observation of a ball of fire in Price, Pennsylvania on February 23, 1954, which disappeared over a hill and started a fire.
interesting points: The report suggests a possible meteor sighting due to the brief duration of the event.
There was no photograph present in the report.
The sighting caused a fire, which burned for approximately 2+ minutes, but the investigators were unable to locate the area of the fire.
Another related sighting involving a glistening stationary light in the sky was noted on May 1, 1952, and police were called to inspect it.
